definition: pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: You're just a little bit easy on eyes .
Tyler checks out the proposals and throws out any bad ideas.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒會親自過目所有提案，把不順眼的扔出箱子。

sentences.english: Status reports are seen as insubordinate.
Luxuriant translation is like nice-looking but phony boxing, pleasant to the eyes, useless as practice.
sentences.chinese: 華麗的譯文就象花拳秀腿，看得順眼，學了無用。

sentences.english: Maybe they don't see eye to eye.
sentences.chinese: 也許它們彼此看不順眼。

sentences.english: But I can't just sit back and watch either. I'm pretty pissed at him too, you know.
sentences.chinese: 但我也不能袖手旁觀，我也看他不順眼，明白嗎？

sentences.english: My father frowns on all but the most conventional of dress.
sentences.chinese: 除最普通的服裝外，我父親都看不順眼。

sentences.english: I need low eyebrow simple on the eyes do a faultless decoration nice.
sentences.chinese: 我只需低眉順眼做一個完美的擺設就好。

sentences.english: Feng Mian Street on the day attracted foreign goods could not comment.
sentences.chinese: 馮老爺子對天街招來洋品牌看不順眼。

sentences.english: All the world is good and agreeable in your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 在你的眼裏天下都是好人，你看誰都順眼。

sentences.english: Whose eye is never pleased has more than tired eyes.
sentences.chinese: 對什麼都看不順眼的人，疲勞的一定不僅僅是眼睛。

definition: (typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to do what one is told/obedient
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
